required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study in Adult and Adolescent Subjects With Seasonal Allergic Rhinitis (SAR)
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled, Parallel-Group, Phase 3 Study to Assess the Efficacy and Safety of Beclomethasone Dipropionate Hydrofluoroalkane (BDP HFA) Nasal Aerosol in Subjects 12 Years of Age and Older With SAR

lead_sponsor.agency: Teva Branded Pharmaceutical Products, R&D Inc.

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of the study is to assess the efficacy and safety of an investigational nasal aerosol compared with placebo nasal aerosol in the treatment of seasonal allergic rhinitis.

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Average Subject-Reported AM and PM Reflective Total Nasal Symptom Score (rTNSS) Over the Two-week Treatment Period
primary_outcome.description: Participants recorded the severity of their nasal symptoms (sneezing, runny nose, nasal itching and nasal congestion) over the past 12 hours (prior to the assessment) twice daily (AM and PM) using the following scale: 0=absent (no sign/symptom present); 1=mild (sign/symptom present, easily tolerated); 2=moderate (definite awareness of sign/symptom, bothersome but tolerable); 3=severe (hard to tolerate, interfere with daily activities and/or sleeping). The rTNSS (sum of 4 symptom scores) ranges from 0 to 12 (worst symptoms). A negative change from baseline score indicates symptom improvement.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Average Subject-Reported AM and PM Instantaneous Total Nasal Symptom Score (iTNSS) Over the Two-week Treatment Period
secondary_outcome.description: Participants recorded the severity of their nasal symptoms (sneezing, runny nose, nasal itching and nasal congestion) over the past 10 minutes (prior to the assessment) twice daily (AM and PM) using the following scale: 0=absent (no sign/symptom present); 1=mild (sign/symptom present, easily tolerated); 2=moderate (definite awareness of sign/symptom, bothersome but tolerable); 3=severe (hard to tolerate, interfere with daily activities). The iTNSS (sum of the 4 symptom scores) ranges from 0 to 12 (worst symptoms). A negative change from baseline score indicates symptom improvement.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline at Week 2 in Rhinoconjunctivitis Quality of Life Questionnaire (RQLQ) in Participants With Impaired Quality of Life at Baseline
secondary_outcome.description: The adult RQLQ has 28 questions in 7 domains. Participants were asked to recall their experiences during the previous week and to give their responses on a 7-point scale (0 = Not Troubled to 6 = Extremely Troubled) for the domains of activities, sleep, non-nose/eye symptoms, practical problems, nasal symptoms, and eye symptoms. The domain of 'emotional' utilized a separate scale (0 = None of the time to 6 = All of the time). The overall RQLQ score is the mean of all 28 responses. Week 2 scores were compared to baseline scores. A negative change from baseline score indicates improvement.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in AM and PM Subject-reported Reflective Ocular Symptom Score Over the 2-week Treatment Period
secondary_outcome.description: Participants recorded the severity of their ocular symptoms (Itching/burning eyes, tearing/watering eyes, and redness of eyes) over the past 12 hours (prior to the assessment) twice daily (AM and PM) using the following scale: 0=absent (no sign/symptom present); 1=mild (sign/symptom present, easily tolerated); 2=moderate (definite awareness of sign/symptom, bothersome but tolerable); 3=severe (sign/symptoms hard to tolerate, interfere with daily activities). The total ocular symptom score ranges from 0 to 9 (worst symptoms). A negative change from baseline score indicates improvement.

arm_group.description: During the 2-week double-blind Treatment Period participants self-administered 4 actuations (two per nostril) of 80 µg BDP HFA once daily each morning.
During the 2-week double-blind Treatment Period participants self-administered four actuations (two per nostril) of placebo HFA once daily each morning.

intervention.description: Total daily dose of 320 micrograms per day of beclomethasone dipropionate (BDP) hydrofluoroalkane (HFA) applied as a nasal aerosol each morning for two weeks.
Placebo nasal aerosol administered each morning for two weeks.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Informed Consent
- Male or female subjects 12 years of age or older
- Documented history of season allergic rhinitis to mountain cedar pollen
- General good health
- Other criteria apply
Exclusion Criteria:
- History of physical findings of nasal pathology (within 60 days prior to screening visit)
- Participation in any investigational drug study 30 days preceding screening visit
- History of respiratory infection/disorder with 14 days preceding screening visit
- Use of any prohibited concomitant medications
- Other criteria apply

overall_official.affiliation: Teva Branded Pharmaceutical Products, R&D Inc.

results_reference.citation: Van Bavel J, Ratner PH, Amar NJ, Hampel FC, Melchior A, Dunbar SA, Tantry SK and Dorinsky PM (2011). BDP HFA Nasal Aerosol 320 μg Once Daily Effectively Improves Ocular Symptoms Associated With Seasonal Allergic Rhinitis. Ann Allergy Asthma Immunol. 107(11):A118.

Van Bavel J, Dorinsky PM, Melchior A, Dunbar SA, and Tantry SK (2011). Nasal Symptom Relief and Improvement in Health-Related Quality of Life Following Treatment with BDP HFA Nasal Aerosol (320 mcg Once Daily) in Subjects with Seasonal Allergic Rhinitis. Allergy Asthma Proc. 32(4):330.

Van Bavel J, Hampel, FC, Ratner PH, Melchior A, Dunbar SA, Tantry SK and Dorinsky PM (2011). BDP HFA Nasal Aerosol Effectively Improves Nasal Symptom Relief and Health-Related Quality of Life (QOL) in Subjects with Seasonal Allergic Rhinitis (SAR). J Allergy Clin Immunol. 127(2):201.

Van Bavel J, Amar NJ, Melchior A, Dunbar SA, Tantry SK and Dorinsky PM (2010).BDP HFA Nasal Aerosol, 320 mcg Once Daily, is Safe and Effective in the Treatment of Nasal Symptoms Associated with Seasonal Allergic Rhinitis (SAR). Ann Allergy Asthma Immunol. 105(5):121.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: A total of 484 patients were screened and 463 patients were enrolled in the study and participated in the Run-in Period. Of the 463 enrolled patients, 340 were randomized to study treatment.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: During the 7 to 10 day Run-in Period, participants self-administered a single-blind placebo nasal aerosol once daily in the morning and assessed and recorded their seasonal rhinitis symptoms twice daily to determine eligibility for randomization.

group.title: BDP HFA 320 µg/Day
group.description: During the 2-week double-blind Treatment Period participants self-administered 4 actuations (two per nostril) of 80 µg beclomethasone dipropionate (BDP) hydrofluoroalkane (HFA) once daily each morning.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: During the 2-week double-blind Treatment Period participants self-administered four actuations (two per nostril) of placebo HFA once daily each morning.

participants_list.participants: Participants who received at least 1 dose of study drug and had at least 1 post-baseline assessment
Participants who received at least 1 dose of study drug and had at least 1 post-baseline assessment
Participants who received at least 1 dose of study drug
Participants who received at least 1 dose of study drug

group.description: During the 2-week double-blind Treatment Period participants self-administered 4 actuations (two per nostril) of 80 µg beclomethasone dipropionate (BDP) hydrofluoroalkane (HFA) once daily each morning.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: During the 2-week double-blind Treatment Period participants self-administered four actuations (two per nostril) of placebo HFA once daily each morning.

measure.title: Age
measure.description: Demographic data are provided for the Intent to Treat population.

measure.title: Race/Ethnicity, Customized
measure.description: A participant may select more than one race type.

class.title: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

outcome.description: Participants recorded the severity of their nasal symptoms (sneezing, runny nose, nasal itching and nasal congestion) over the past 12 hours (prior to the assessment) twice daily (AM and PM) using the following scale: 0=absent (no sign/symptom present); 1=mild (sign/symptom present, easily tolerated); 2=moderate (definite awareness of sign/symptom, bothersome but tolerable); 3=severe (hard to tolerate, interfere with daily activities and/or sleeping). The rTNSS (sum of 4 symptom scores) ranges from 0 to 12 (worst symptoms). A negative change from baseline score indicates symptom improvement.

group.description: During the 2-week double-blind Treatment Period participants self-administered 4 actuations (two per nostril) of 80 µg beclomethasone dipropionate (BDP) hydrofluoroalkane (HFA) once daily each morning.

group.description: During the 2-week double-blind Treatment Period participants self-administered four actuations (two per nostril) of placebo HFA once daily each morning.

measure.title: Change From Baseline in Average Subject-Reported AM and PM Reflective Total Nasal Symptom Score (rTNSS) Over the Two-week Treatment Period
measure.description: Participants recorded the severity of their nasal symptoms (sneezing, runny nose, nasal itching and nasal congestion) over the past 12 hours (prior to the assessment) twice daily (AM and PM) using the following scale: 0=absent (no sign/symptom present); 1=mild (sign/symptom present, easily tolerated); 2=moderate (definite awareness of sign/symptom, bothersome but tolerable); 3=severe (hard to tolerate, interfere with daily activities and/or sleeping). The rTNSS (sum of 4 symptom scores) ranges from 0 to 12 (worst symptoms). A negative change from baseline score indicates symptom improvement.

analysis.p_value_desc: A priori threshold for statistical significance is p<0.05.
analysis.method_desc: Repeated measures ANCOVA included covariate adjustment for baseline, day, treatment, and the treatment by day interaction.
analysis.param_type: LS mean treatment diff from placebo

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Average Subject-Reported AM and PM Instantaneous Total Nasal Symptom Score (iTNSS) Over the Two-week Treatment Period
outcome.description: Participants recorded the severity of their nasal symptoms (sneezing, runny nose, nasal itching and nasal congestion) over the past 10 minutes (prior to the assessment) twice daily (AM and PM) using the following scale: 0=absent (no sign/symptom present); 1=mild (sign/symptom present, easily tolerated); 2=moderate (definite awareness of sign/symptom, bothersome but tolerable); 3=severe (hard to tolerate, interfere with daily activities). The iTNSS (sum of the 4 symptom scores) ranges from 0 to 12 (worst symptoms). A negative change from baseline score indicates symptom improvement.

group.description: During the 2-week double-blind Treatment Period participants self-administered 4 actuations (two per nostril) of 80 µg beclomethasone dipropionate (BDP) hydrofluoroalkane (HFA) once daily each morning.

measure.description: Participants recorded the severity of their nasal symptoms (sneezing, runny nose, nasal itching and nasal congestion) over the past 10 minutes (prior to the assessment) twice daily (AM and PM) using the following scale: 0=absent (no sign/symptom present); 1=mild (sign/symptom present, easily tolerated); 2=moderate (definite awareness of sign/symptom, bothersome but tolerable); 3=severe (hard to tolerate, interfere with daily activities). The iTNSS (sum of the 4 symptom scores) ranges from 0 to 12 (worst symptoms). A negative change from baseline score indicates symptom improvement.

analysis.p_value_desc: A priori threshold for statistical significance is p<0.05
analysis.method_desc: The repeated measures ANCOVA included covariate adjustment for baseline, day, treatment, and the treatment by day interaction.
analysis.param_type: LS mean treatment diff from placebo

outcome.title: Change From Baseline at Week 2 in Rhinoconjunctivitis Quality of Life Questionnaire (RQLQ) in Participants With Impaired Quality of Life at Baseline
outcome.description: The adult RQLQ has 28 questions in 7 domains. Participants were asked to recall their experiences during the previous week and to give their responses on a 7-point scale (0 = Not Troubled to 6 = Extremely Troubled) for the domains of activities, sleep, non-nose/eye symptoms, practical problems, nasal symptoms, and eye symptoms. The domain of ‘emotional’ utilized a separate scale (0 = None of the time to 6 = All of the time). The overall RQLQ score is the mean of all 28 responses. Week 2 scores were compared to baseline scores. A negative change from baseline score indicates improvement.
outcome.population: The RQLQ population, subset of ITT population, included only those participants over the age of 18 years (fluent in English) with an impaired quality of life at Baseline as defined by a RQLQ score at Day 0 of 3.0 or greater.

group.title: BDP HFA 320 µg/Day
group.description: During the 2-week double-blind Treatment Period participants self-administered 4 actuations (two per nostril) of 80 µg beclomethasone dipropionate (BDP) hydrofluoroalkane (HFA) once daily each morning.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: During the 2-week double-blind Treatment Period participants self-administered four actuations (two per nostril) of placebo HFA once daily each morning.

measure.title: Change From Baseline at Week 2 in Rhinoconjunctivitis Quality of Life Questionnaire (RQLQ) in Participants With Impaired Quality of Life at Baseline
measure.description: The adult RQLQ has 28 questions in 7 domains. Participants were asked to recall their experiences during the previous week and to give their responses on a 7-point scale (0 = Not Troubled to 6 = Extremely Troubled) for the domains of activities, sleep, non-nose/eye symptoms, practical problems, nasal symptoms, and eye symptoms. The domain of ‘emotional’ utilized a separate scale (0 = None of the time to 6 = All of the time). The overall RQLQ score is the mean of all 28 responses. Week 2 scores were compared to baseline scores. A negative change from baseline score indicates improvement.
measure.population: The RQLQ population, subset of ITT population, included only those participants over the age of 18 years (fluent in English) with an impaired quality of life at Baseline as defined by a RQLQ score at Day 0 of 3.0 or greater.

analysis.p_value_desc: A priori threshold for statistical significance is p<0.05
analysis.method_desc: Results obtained from ANCOVA with treatment, baseline and center in the model.
analysis.param_type: LS mean treatment diff from placebo

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Sponsor has the right 60 days before submission for publication to review/provide comments. If the Sponsor’s review shows that potentially patentable subject matter would be disclosed, publication or public disclosure shall be delayed for up to 90 additional days in order for the Sponsor, or Sponsor’s designees, to file the necessary patent applications. In multicenter trials, each PI will postpone single center publications until after disclosure or publication of multicenter data.

point_of_contact.organization: Teva Branded Pharmaceutical Products, R&D Inc.
